Kang Ming

Aspiring Entrepreneur, Computer Engineer, Innovator

About Me

My name is Kang Ming and I am currently a year 2 Computer Engineering (CEG) student from the National University of Singapore (NUS).

I am a highly motivated individual who is passionate about entrepreneurship and technology. I believe that my passion for learning, coupled with my technical expertise, will allow me to contribute to any organisation/startup looking to develop innovative and useful products.

Currently, I am on the NUS Overseas College Programme (Toronto) and working in a wealth asset management startup, D1g1T.inc, which leverages on an advanced analytics and data visualisation tool to provide transparent portfolio management services to professional advisers and investors.

Contact Details

Stay Tuned!

More upcoming projects!

Nocbot

During my stay in Residential College 4 (RC4), I developed an application to revolutionize the game known as “Angel and Mortal”. By using a telegram chatbot to allow 2 users to chat with each other anonymously, a participant does not have to rely solely on written letters to communicate with one’s Angel or Mortal. The purpose of creating this application was to foster greater communication between the Angel and Mortal pair as this was an annual social event that would be played in RC4.

Telegram chatbot
Details Close

Tele-operated robot with autonomous backtracking capabilities

During Semester 2 of my first year, my team and I worked on building a tele-operated robot, with an autonomous backtracking feature, designed for search-and-rescue (SAR) missions in the event of a crisis / natural disaster and is controlled remotely via the Internet (Tele-operated). This was part of a module titled "Engineering Principles and Practices 2" which taught me the fundamental principles of information processing, ROS programming and security and network protocols.

Internet-of-things, Robotics Operating System (ROS)
Close

Restaurant Management System

This Command-Line Interface (CLI) application was created by my team for the NUS module CS2113T titled, Software Engineering & Object-Oriented Programming. The project lasted for around 10 weeks and we were expected to work with an existing java sample codebase provided. The objective of this module was to learn how to work in a scrum environment, to innovate and develop the existing codebase into a desktop application for a specific group of users - restaurant owners.

Software Development
